verbose_text: Programmed -1 ribosomal frameshifting is common for many members of the Flaviviridae, mostly to synthesize additional functional proteins, e.g., the overlapping fifo ORF in the NS2A/2B coding region of insect specific flavivirus genomes and the antigenic hepatitis C virus alternate reading frame protein (ARFP), but also to divert a proportion of the ribosomes for the synthesis of proteins encoded nearer the 5 ' end [XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR].
evidence: Programmed -1 ribosomal frameshifting is common for many members of the Flaviviridae, mostly to synthesize additional functional proteins, e.g., the overlapping fifo ORF
